Truncation of Ul elements
In certain situations, it's not possible to display all Ul elements in the determined space.
There are two possible solutions: allowing users to scroll through options when vertical
space is limited, or to expand the options on page if there's no harm in pushing content
down.
Scrollable overflow
In situations of limited horizontal and vertical space, a scrollable overflow allows users
to access a large number of items by swiping or scrolling horizontally. The Carousel
component can be utilized to provide additional controls such as pagination and a
progress indicator.
Best for:
¢ Displaying a larger quantity of secondary content
¢ Displaying content within limited vertical space

Expandable overflow
While a scrollable overflow typically suits more vertically-restrictive areas, expandable
overflows are used when the content can take up a more substantial portion of the
screen, but the maximum height still needs to be limited to allow for other groups to be
accessible. Typically, a Button is used to trigger the expansion.
Best for:
¢ Limiting the length of primary content so other content can be reached below
